lawSummary: Transfer of Property Act, 1882 governs lease contracts in India. The Act defines lease as a transfer of a right to enjoy immovable property for a certain time. Key sections include Section 105 (definition), Section 106 (duration), Section 107 (mode of transfer), Section 111 (termination), and Section 108 (rights and liabilities).

requiredClauses.title: Termination Clause
requiredClauses.draftingHints: Both parties should be allowed to terminate with mutual notice. Notice period should be reasonable (typically 15-30 days). Include specific conditions for termination.

requiredClauses.title: Force Majeure
requiredClauses.legalBasis: Contract Law Principle, Section 56 of Indian Contract Act
requiredClauses.draftingHints: Include events like fire, flood, pandemic, natural disasters, and their effect on rent obligations. Should provide relief to both parties.

requiredClauses.title: Security Deposit
requiredClauses.draftingHints: Deposit should be reasonable (typically 1-3 months rent). Specify return timeline (usually 7-30 days). List specific deduction conditions.

requiredClauses.title: Rent Payment Terms
requiredClauses.draftingHints: Specify exact due date, reasonable late fees (not exceeding 5-10% of rent), and grace period. Include payment methods.

requiredClauses.title: Maintenance and Repairs
requiredClauses.draftingHints: Clearly define who is responsible for what repairs. Major structural repairs are landlord's responsibility. Minor repairs can be tenant's responsibility.

requiredClauses.title: Sub-letting and Assignment
requiredClauses.draftingHints: Should allow sub-letting with landlord's written consent, which cannot be unreasonably withheld. Include process for seeking consent.

requiredClauses.title: Utilities and Services
requiredClauses.draftingHints: Specify who pays for utilities, maintenance charges, and services. Include service standards and complaint procedures.

requiredClauses.title: Dispute Resolution
requiredClauses.draftingHints: Include mediation, arbitration, or court jurisdiction. Specify governing law and dispute resolution process.
